Description: Clay sealing around a roll of brown cloth. A sealing from a document with the impression of the papyrus to which it was attached and the remains of a textile strip, which bound the packet. The clay of the sealing was impressed five times with the same intaglio gem, a profile head of Isis. Micaceous grey-brown Nile mud, unfired; the textile is now dark brown.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV The head of Isis is apparently the same image as the one used also on Terracotta 3624. The textile has been identified by Hero Granger-Taylor as a warp-faced simple tabby weave, S-spin linen, probably undyed and yellowish, the warp c.22 ends per cm, the weft c.12 picks per cm.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3623)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir John Davidson Beazley
